intro: Acmispon plebeius, commonly known as the plains blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant has compound leaves with thread-like leaflets and produces small, rounded seed pods. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils, often growing in full sun. Acmispon plebeius is an important forage plant for livestock and supports various pollinators.
